name: World Bank Indicators API
description: Provides programmatic access to nearly 16,000 time series indicators covering over 50 years of development data from World Development Indicators, International Debt Statistics, and other World Bank databases. The API offers comprehensive global development data including economic, social, environmental, and institutional metrics across 200+ countries and territories.

access_info.pricing_model: Free for public data with open access policy
access_info.rate_limits: 15,000 data points per SDMX call, URL length restrictions of 1,500 characters between slashes

endpoints.description: Returns information about countries including ISO codes, regional classifications, income levels
Retrieves metadata about specific indicators including definitions and source information
Returns time series data for specific indicators and countries

content_summary.geographic_scope: Global - 200+ countries and territories
content_summary.update_frequency: Annual, quarterly, and monthly depending on indicator

research_notes.data_quality: High quality with comprehensive metadata and source documentation
research_notes.researcher_notes: API version 2 is current, with version 1 deprecated as of June 2020. Extensive third-party library support in Python, R, and JavaScript.
research_notes.api_summary: The World Bank API represents one of the most comprehensive open data initiatives in international development, providing free access to decades of global development indicators without authentication requirements. It serves researchers, policymakers, and developers worldwide with standardized economic, social, and environmental data across countries, supporting evidence-based analysis and decision-making in development work.

name: IMF Data Services API
description: Provides access to IMF's extensive collection of macroeconomic and financial statistics through SDMX-compliant REST APIs. Includes International Financial Statistics, Balance of Payments, Government Finance Statistics, and other key economic datasets used for global economic analysis and policy research.

access_info.pricing_model: Free access with attribution requirements
access_info.rate_limits: 10 requests per IP per 5 seconds, 50 requests per second globally

technical_info.auth_method: None - monitored via user agent headers

endpoints.description: Lists available datasets including BOP, IFS, and other statistical databases
Returns structural metadata for specified database including dimensions and code lists
Retrieves time series data for specified database and dimension combinations

content_summary.geographic_scope: Global - IMF member countries
content_summary.update_frequency: Monthly, quarterly, and annual depending on series

research_notes.data_quality: High quality official statistics with comprehensive methodology documentation
research_notes.researcher_notes: SDMX-compliant API requires understanding of dimension codes. Third-party libraries like imfp (Python) and imfr (R) simplify access.
research_notes.api_summary: The IMF Data Services API provides authoritative access to the world's most comprehensive collection of macroeconomic and financial statistics, serving as a critical resource for economic research, policy analysis, and financial market surveillance. Built on SDMX standards, it offers structured access to datasets that form the backbone of global economic monitoring and International Monetary Fund operations.

name: OECD Statistics API
provider: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development
description: RESTful API providing access to OECD's comprehensive statistical databases covering economic, social, and environmental indicators for OECD countries and partner economies. Based on SDMX-JSON standards, it offers data on education, health, trade, finance, innovation, and sustainable development metrics.

access_info.pricing_model: Free access under OECD open data policy
access_info.rate_limits: Reasonable use policy - no specific limits documented

endpoints.description: Retrieves data from specified dataset with optional filtering by dimensions
endpoints.response_format: SDMX-JSON format with time series data

endpoints.description: Returns data structure definition for specified dataset including dimensions and codelists

content_summary.geographic_scope: OECD countries plus key partner economies
content_summary.update_frequency: Varies by indicator - monthly, quarterly, annual

research_notes.data_quality: High quality official statistics with detailed methodology documentation
research_notes.researcher_notes: SDMX-JSON format requires understanding of dataset structures. R package 'OECD' and Python libraries available for simplified access.
research_notes.api_summary: The OECD Statistics API serves as a comprehensive gateway to official statistics from one of the world's premier economic organizations, providing researchers, policymakers, and analysts with standardized data essential for comparative economic analysis across developed economies. The API's SDMX compliance ensures interoperability with statistical software while supporting evidence-based policy research across multiple domains.

name: UNdata API
description: Provides programmatic access to UN statistical databases covering global development indicators, demographic data, economic statistics, and social metrics from across the UN system. Offers unified access to data from multiple UN agencies through standardized REST interfaces.

access_info.pricing_model: Free access with API key registration
access_info.rate_limits: Standard rate limits apply - not specifically documented

technical_info.auth_method: API key via query parameter (app_id and app_key)

endpoints.description: Lists available UN organizations providing data through the API
Returns databases available from specified UN organization
Lists datasets available from specified organization

content_summary.geographic_scope: Global - UN member states and territories
content_summary.update_frequency: Varies by dataset - annual, quarterly, monthly

research_notes.data_quality: Official UN statistics with comprehensive global coverage
research_notes.researcher_notes: Requires API key registration. Provides unified access to multiple UN agency databases. Some inconsistency in data availability across agencies.
research_notes.api_summary: The UNdata API serves as a centralized gateway to the United Nations' vast collection of global statistics, enabling researchers and policymakers to access authoritative data on economic, social, and environmental indicators from across the UN system. This unified interface simplifies access to traditionally fragmented UN databases while maintaining the integrity and official status of the underlying statistical data.

name: WHO Global Health Observatory API
description: Provides access to WHO's comprehensive health statistics and indicators covering disease surveillance, health system performance, risk factors, and health outcomes for all WHO member states. The API offers both current and historical health data essential for global health monitoring and research.

access_info.pricing_model: Free access under WHO open data policy
access_info.rate_limits: Reasonable use policy - no specific limits documented

endpoints.description: Lists all available health indicators with metadata including definitions and data sources
endpoints.response_format: JSON/XML list of indicators with metadata

endpoints.description: Returns available dimensions such as countries, years, and demographic breakdowns
Retrieves data for specific health indicator across countries and time periods

content_summary.geographic_scope: Global - WHO member states (194 countries)
content_summary.update_frequency: Annual updates for most indicators, some quarterly

research_notes.data_quality: High quality official health statistics with WHO validation processes
research_notes.researcher_notes: OData-compliant API with extensive filtering capabilities. Legacy Athena API being phased out in favor of current system.
research_notes.api_summary: The WHO Global Health Observatory API provides authoritative access to the world's most comprehensive collection of health statistics, enabling researchers, health professionals, and policymakers to monitor global health trends and assess progress toward health-related sustainable development goals. The API serves as the primary digital gateway to WHO's evidence base for global health governance and public health emergency response.

name: European Central Bank Statistical Data Warehouse API
description: SDMX-compliant REST API providing access to comprehensive monetary, financial, and economic statistics for the European Union and euro area. Includes exchange rates, interest rates, monetary aggregates, banking statistics, and other key indicators for European monetary policy analysis.

access_info.pricing_model: Free access under ECB open data policy
access_info.rate_limits: No explicit limits documented - reasonable use expected

endpoints.description: Lists all available datasets with metadata including descriptions and update frequencies
Returns data structure definition for specified dataset including dimensions and code lists
Retrieves time series data for specified dataset and key combination

content_summary.geographic_scope: European Union, Euro Area, and selected international data
content_summary.update_frequency: Daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly depending on series

research_notes.data_quality: Highest quality official statistics from European Central Bank
research_notes.researcher_notes: SDMX 2.1 compliant with comprehensive documentation. Multiple R and Python packages available including 'ecb' for R and 'ecbdata' for Python.
research_notes.api_summary: The ECB Statistical Data Warehouse API provides authoritative access to the European Central Bank's comprehensive collection of monetary and financial statistics, serving as an essential resource for economic research, policy analysis, and financial market monitoring across the European Union and euro area. The SDMX-compliant interface ensures high-quality, standardized data access for academic research and professional financial analysis.

name: Bank of England Statistical Interactive Database API
description: REST API providing access to UK monetary and financial statistics including interest rates, money supply, credit conditions, and financial stability indicators. Offers comprehensive data on UK monetary policy implementation and financial sector performance.

access_info.pricing_model: Free access under Bank of England open data policy
access_info.rate_limits: No explicit limits documented

endpoints.description: Retrieves time series data for specified series codes with date range filtering

content_summary.geographic_scope: United Kingdom with some international data
content_summary.update_frequency: Daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly depending on series

research_notes.data_quality: High quality official UK monetary and financial statistics
research_notes.researcher_notes: Simple REST interface with CSV output. Series codes must be known in advance. Limited API documentation compared to other central banks.
research_notes.api_summary: The Bank of England API provides essential access to UK monetary and financial statistics that underpin British economic policy and financial market operations. While technically simpler than some central bank APIs, it delivers authoritative data crucial for understanding UK monetary policy transmission, financial stability conditions, and broader economic trends affecting the British economy.

name: FRED API
provider: Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis
description: REST API providing access to over 827,000 economic time series from 117 sources including Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) and ALFRED (Archival FRED). Comprehensive US economic indicators covering monetary policy, labor markets, inflation, GDP, and financial conditions with extensive historical coverage.

access_info.pricing_model: Free with API key registration
access_info.rate_limits: 120 calls per 60 seconds per API key

endpoints.description: Returns time series observations for specified series ID with date filtering options
endpoints.response_format: JSON/XML with time series data points

endpoints.description: Returns metadata information for specified economic series including title, units, frequency
Searches for economic series based on text query with filtering and sorting options

content_summary.geographic_scope: United States with extensive state and local coverage, plus international data
content_summary.update_frequency: Real-time updates as data becomes available - daily to annual

research_notes.data_quality: Highest quality official US economic statistics with real-time data availability
research_notes.researcher_notes: Comprehensive API with excellent documentation. Wide third-party library support including fredapi (Python) and FredR (R). Historical vintages available through ALFRED.
research_notes.api_summary: The FRED API represents the gold standard for accessing US economic data, providing researchers, analysts, and policymakers with real-time access to the most comprehensive collection of American economic statistics. Maintained by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis, it serves as an essential infrastructure for economic research, forecasting, and policy analysis across academia, government, and the financial sector.

name: Bureau of Labor Statistics API
description: REST API providing access to official US labor market statistics including employment, unemployment, wages, productivity, and price indices. Offers comprehensive workforce data essential for economic analysis and labor market research with extensive historical coverage.

access_info.pricing_model: Free with optional registration for higher limits
access_info.rate_limits: 25 queries per day (unregistered), 500 queries per day (registered)

technical_info.auth_method: Optional API key for higher rate limits

endpoints.description: Retrieves time series data for specified BLS series IDs with date range filtering

content_summary.geographic_scope: United States with state and metropolitan area detail
content_summary.update_frequency: Monthly and quarterly releases following official schedule

research_notes.data_quality: Official US labor statistics with highest quality standards
research_notes.researcher_notes: POST-based API requiring series IDs to be known in advance. Limited to 25 series per request. Registration increases daily limits significantly.
research_notes.api_summary: The Bureau of Labor Statistics API provides authoritative access to the United States' official labor market data, serving as a critical resource for economists, policymakers, researchers, and business analysts monitoring employment trends and workforce conditions. The API delivers the same high-quality statistics that drive federal policy decisions and economic research across the nation.

name: U.S. Census Bureau APIs
description: Comprehensive collection of REST APIs providing access to demographic, economic, and geographic data from censuses, surveys, and estimates. Includes American Community Survey, Economic Census, Population Estimates, and other critical datasets for understanding American society and economy.

access_info.pricing_model: Free with API key registration
access_info.rate_limits: 500 queries per IP address per day

endpoints.description: American Community Survey 5-year estimates providing detailed demographic and housing characteristics
Population Estimates Program providing annual population estimates by geography
County Business Patterns providing business and employment statistics by industry and geography

content_summary.geographic_scope: United States with detail to block level for some datasets
content_summary.update_frequency: Annual, with some monthly and quarterly series

research_notes.data_quality: Highest quality official US demographic and economic statistics
research_notes.researcher_notes: Multiple APIs for different datasets. Requires understanding of variable codes and geographic hierarchies. Extensive documentation and examples available.
research_notes.api_summary: The U.S. Census Bureau APIs provide unparalleled access to the most comprehensive and authoritative collection of American demographic, social, and economic data. These APIs serve researchers, businesses, governments, and nonprofits with the detailed information needed to understand population trends, economic conditions, and social characteristics that shape American communities and inform critical policy decisions.

name: Data.gov API
description: Catalog API providing access to metadata about thousands of U.S. government datasets across federal, state, and local agencies. Serves as the central directory for American open government data with search and discovery capabilities for public sector information.

access_info.pricing_model: Free public access
access_info.rate_limits: No explicit limits documented

endpoints.description: Searches for datasets using keywords, filters, and facets with pagination support
Returns detailed metadata for a specific dataset including resources and organization info
Lists government organizations contributing data to the catalog

content_summary.geographic_scope: United States - federal, state, and local government data
content_summary.update_frequency: Continuous updates as agencies publish new datasets

research_notes.data_quality: Metadata quality varies by contributing agency
research_notes.researcher_notes: CKAN-based catalog API providing metadata only - actual data URLs must be accessed separately. Extensive search and filtering capabilities.
research_notes.api_summary: The Data.gov API serves as the central discovery mechanism for the United States government's open data initiative, providing researchers, developers, and citizens with comprehensive metadata about thousands of federal, state, and local datasets. While it functions as a catalog rather than direct data provider, it enables efficient discovery and access to the vast landscape of American public sector information resources.

name: Data.gov.uk API
description: CKAN-based catalog API providing metadata about UK government datasets from central and local government agencies. Enables discovery and access to British public sector data across numerous policy domains and government levels.

access_info.pricing_model: Free public access under UK Open Government License
access_info.rate_limits: No explicit limits documented

endpoints.description: Searches UK government datasets using keywords, themes, and organizational filters
Returns detailed information about specific UK government datasets

content_summary.geographic_scope: United Kingdom - England, Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland
content_summary.update_frequency: Continuous as government agencies publish data

research_notes.data_quality: Varies by department - generally high quality government data
research_notes.researcher_notes: Standard CKAN API implementation. Provides metadata catalog rather than direct data access. Strong organizational and thematic filtering capabilities.
research_notes.api_summary: The Data.gov.uk API provides essential access to the UK government's open data catalog, enabling researchers, businesses, and citizens to discover and access thousands of public sector datasets. As the central hub for British government transparency initiatives, it facilitates evidence-based research and democratic accountability through comprehensive metadata about official UK data resources.

name: Data.gouv.fr API
description: REST API providing access to French government open data catalog with thousands of datasets from national and local administrations. Includes demographic, economic, environmental, and administrative data covering all aspects of French public sector information.

access_info.pricing_model: Free under French Open License
access_info.rate_limits: No explicit limits documented

technical_info.auth_method: None for read access - API key for write operations

endpoints.description: Lists and searches French government datasets with filtering and pagination
Returns detailed information about specific French dataset including resources
Lists French government organizations contributing open data

content_summary.geographic_scope: France including overseas territories and departments
content_summary.update_frequency: Continuous updates from participating organizations

research_notes.data_quality: High quality official French government data
research_notes.researcher_notes: Well-documented REST API with comprehensive search capabilities. Supports French language metadata with some English translations available.
research_notes.api_summary: The Data.gouv.fr API serves as France's premier gateway to public sector information, providing comprehensive access to thousands of datasets from French national and local governments. Managed by Etalab, it supports France's digital government initiatives and open data policies, enabling researchers, businesses, and citizens to access official French administrative, economic, and social data.

name: OpenDataSoft API
description: Unified API platform providing access to thousands of open datasets from government agencies, research institutions, and organizations worldwide. Offers standardized access to diverse data sources with powerful search, filtering, and analytics capabilities.

access_info.pricing_model: Freemium - free tier with limits, paid plans for higher usage
access_info.rate_limits: 10,000 API calls per month on free tier

technical_info.auth_method: API key for higher limits, anonymous for basic access

endpoints.description: Searches across thousands of open datasets from multiple organizations and portals
Retrieves actual data records from specified dataset with filtering and aggregation

content_summary.geographic_scope: Global - aggregated from worldwide sources
content_summary.update_frequency: Varies by source dataset

research_notes.data_quality: Varies by source - aggregates from multiple providers
research_notes.researcher_notes: Powerful unified platform aggregating data from multiple open data portals. Strong geographic and analytical capabilities with built-in visualization tools.
research_notes.api_summary: OpenDataSoft provides a unique unified API approach to open data access, aggregating thousands of datasets from government agencies, research institutions, and organizations worldwide into a single searchable platform. This comprehensive approach enables researchers and developers to discover and access diverse data sources through standardized interfaces, significantly reducing the complexity of working with multiple open data portals.

name: European Data Portal API
description: CKAN-based API providing metadata about open datasets from European Union member states, institutions, and agencies. Serves as the central catalog for European public sector information with standardized access across multiple countries and languages.

access_info.pricing_model: Free access under EU open data policies
access_info.rate_limits: No explicit limits documented

endpoints.description: Searches European datasets with country, theme, and language filters
Lists European data catalogs from member states and EU institutions

content_summary.geographic_scope: European Union member states plus associated countries
content_summary.update_frequency: Regular updates from member state portals

research_notes.data_quality: Varies by member state - generally high quality government data
research_notes.researcher_notes: Aggregates metadata from 27+ EU member states. Multilingual support with standardized European data themes and vocabularies.
research_notes.api_summary: The European Data Portal API provides essential infrastructure for discovering and accessing open government data across the European Union, enabling researchers, businesses, and citizens to find relevant datasets from 27 member states and EU institutions through a single, standardized interface. This cross-border approach facilitates comparative European research and supports the EU's digital single market objectives.

name: NASA Open APIs
description: Collection of REST APIs providing access to NASA's extensive space, Earth science, and astronomical data including satellite imagery, planetary data, astronaut information, and space weather. Offers both current missions data and historical space exploration archives.

access_info.pricing_model: Free with API key registration
access_info.rate_limits: 1,000 requests per hour per API key

endpoints.description: Returns NASA's Astronomy Picture of the Day with description and metadata
endpoints.response_format: JSON with image URL and metadata

endpoints.description: Retrieves Landsat 8 satellite imagery for specified coordinates and dates
Near Earth Object data including asteroid approaches and orbital information

content_summary.geographic_scope: Global Earth coverage plus planetary and deep space data
content_summary.update_frequency: Real-time to daily depending on data source

research_notes.data_quality: Highest quality space and Earth science data from NASA missions
research_notes.researcher_notes: Multiple specialized APIs for different data types. Excellent documentation with interactive examples. Some endpoints provide real mission data.
research_notes.api_summary: NASA's Open APIs provide unprecedented public access to the world's most comprehensive collection of space exploration and Earth science data, enabling researchers, educators, developers, and space enthusiasts to integrate authoritative NASA mission data into applications and research. These APIs democratize access to cutting-edge space science while supporting STEM education and public engagement with space exploration.

name: NOAA Climate Data Online API
description: REST API providing access to NOAA's comprehensive weather and climate datasets including historical weather records, climate summaries, and severe weather events. Offers the most extensive collection of US weather and climate data for research and analysis.

access_info.pricing_model: Free with API token registration
access_info.rate_limits: 1,000 requests per day per token

endpoints.description: Lists available climate and weather datasets with metadata and coverage information
Retrieves weather and climate observations for specified parameters and time periods
Lists weather stations with location information and data availability periods

content_summary.geographic_scope: United States with extensive global coverage for many datasets
content_summary.update_frequency: Daily updates for current data, historical records complete

research_notes.data_quality: Highest quality official US weather and climate data
research_notes.researcher_notes: Comprehensive weather and climate API with extensive historical coverage. Requires understanding of dataset IDs and station networks.
research_notes.api_summary: The NOAA Climate Data Online API provides researchers, scientists, and developers with authoritative access to the world's largest archive of weather and climate data, spanning over 175 years of observations from thousands of weather stations worldwide. This API serves as the primary source for climate research, weather analysis, and environmental monitoring applications across academic, government, and commercial sectors.

name: USGS Web Services
description: Collection of REST APIs providing access to geological, hydrological, and environmental data including water resources, earthquakes, minerals, and geographic information. Offers real-time monitoring data and extensive historical datasets for Earth science research.

access_info.pricing_model: Free public access
access_info.rate_limits: No explicit limits documented - reasonable use expected

endpoints.description: Retrieves real-time water monitoring data from USGS stream gauges and groundwater sites
Returns daily water data values including streamflow, water levels, and water quality parameters
Provides metadata about USGS monitoring sites including location and available parameters

content_summary.geographic_scope: United States including territories and some international data
content_summary.update_frequency: Real-time for monitoring data, periodic for surveys and assessments

research_notes.data_quality: Highest quality official US geological and hydrological data
research_notes.researcher_notes: Multiple specialized APIs for different data types. Water services API is most comprehensive. Real-time data availability varies by site.
research_notes.api_summary: USGS Web Services provide authoritative access to the United States' most comprehensive collection of geological, hydrological, and environmental monitoring data, serving researchers, water managers, emergency responders, and the public with real-time and historical information essential for understanding Earth processes and managing natural resources. These APIs support critical applications in water resource management, earthquake monitoring, and environmental research.

name: European Space Agency APIs
description: Collection of APIs providing access to satellite data, space mission information, and Earth observation datasets from ESA missions including Sentinel satellites, planetary missions, and space science programs. Offers comprehensive European space data for research and applications.

access_info.pricing_model: Free registration required for most services
access_info.rate_limits: Varies by service - generally reasonable use policies

endpoints.description: Searches and retrieves Copernicus satellite data including Sentinel-1, 2, 3, and 5P products
Downloads actual satellite data products after search and selection

content_summary.geographic_scope: Global coverage with focus on Europe and surrounding regions
content_summary.update_frequency: Near real-time for operational missions, varies by mission type

research_notes.data_quality: Highest quality European satellite data with rigorous calibration
research_notes.researcher_notes: Registration required for Copernicus Open Access Hub. Large data files requiring substantial bandwidth. Python and other client libraries available.
research_notes.api_summary: The European Space Agency APIs provide access to Europe's premier collection of satellite Earth observation data and space mission information, enabling researchers, government agencies, and commercial users to access high-quality Copernicus programme data for environmental monitoring, climate research, and geospatial applications. These APIs serve as critical infrastructure for European space data policy and global Earth observation initiatives.

name: OpenWeatherMap API
description: Comprehensive weather API providing current weather, forecasts, historical data, and weather maps for any location worldwide. Offers multiple pricing tiers from free basic access to professional weather services with high-frequency updates and advanced features.

access_info.pricing_model: Freemium - free tier with 1,000 calls/day, paid plans from $40/month
access_info.rate_limits: 60 calls/minute for free tier, higher limits for paid plans

endpoints.description: Returns current weather conditions for specified location including temperature, humidity, pressure
Provides 5-day weather forecast with 3-hour intervals for any location
Comprehensive weather data including current, forecast, and historical weather in one call

content_summary.geographic_scope: Global coverage for all locations worldwide
content_summary.update_frequency: Real-time updates every 10 minutes for current weather

research_notes.data_quality: Commercial quality weather data with global coverage
research_notes.researcher_notes: Popular commercial weather API with generous free tier. Extensive documentation and SDKs available for multiple programming languages.
research_notes.api_summary: OpenWeatherMap API serves as one of the world's most widely used commercial weather data services, providing developers, businesses, and researchers with reliable access to global weather information through a well-designed REST API. With millions of users worldwide, it supports applications ranging from mobile weather apps to agricultural management systems and logistics optimization.

name: Climate Data Online API
description: NOAA's comprehensive climate data service providing access to weather and climate observations from thousands of stations worldwide. Includes daily weather summaries, climate normals, and extreme weather events with extensive historical coverage dating back over 175 years.

access_info.pricing_model: Free with registration for API token
access_info.rate_limits: 1,000 requests per day per token

endpoints.description: Lists available climate datasets with coverage information and temporal ranges
Retrieves actual climate and weather observation data for specified parameters
Returns geographic locations and regions with available climate data

content_summary.geographic_scope: Global with emphasis on United States and territories
content_summary.update_frequency: Daily updates for recent data, historical records complete

research_notes.data_quality: Authoritative US government climate data with quality controls
research_notes.researcher_notes: Same API as NOAA CDO but branded under NCEI. Comprehensive historical weather data with strict quality control procedures.
research_notes.api_summary: The Climate Data Online API represents the United States government's authoritative source for historical weather and climate data, providing researchers, scientists, and analysts with access to over 175 years of quality-controlled observations from thousands of weather stations worldwide. This service supports critical climate research, environmental impact assessments, and long-term climate trend analysis essential for understanding climate change and variability.

name: Global Biodiversity Information Facility API
description: REST API providing access to over 1.4 billion species occurrence records and taxonomic information from natural history collections, observations, and research datasets worldwide. Serves as the primary global infrastructure for biodiversity data sharing and research.

access_info.pricing_model: Free access under GBIF data sharing principles
access_info.rate_limits: No explicit rate limits - reasonable use expected

technical_info.auth_method: None for read access - authentication required for data publishing

endpoints.description: Searches species occurrence records with geographic, taxonomic, and temporal filters
Searches taxonomic information including species names, classifications, and synonyms
Lists and searches biodiversity datasets with metadata and publishing organization info

content_summary.geographic_scope: Global coverage with data from all continents and marine environments
content_summary.update_frequency: Continuous updates from data publishers worldwide

research_notes.data_quality: Variable quality - depends on data publisher standards and verification
research_notes.researcher_notes: Massive database with over 1.4 billion records. Data quality varies significantly. Strong API documentation with R and Python client libraries available.
research_notes.api_summary: The GBIF API provides researchers, conservationists, and policymakers with unprecedented access to the world's largest collection of biodiversity data, enabling species distribution modeling, conservation planning, and ecological research at local to global scales. As the backbone of global biodiversity informatics, it facilitates evidence-based conservation decisions and scientific understanding of species distributions and ecosystem patterns.

name: iNaturalist API
description: REST API providing access to community-contributed biodiversity observations, species identifications, and taxonomic data from the world's largest nature crowdsourcing platform. Includes photos, locations, and expert identifications from millions of naturalists worldwide.

access_info.pricing_model: Free access with community data sharing principles
access_info.rate_limits: 60 requests per minute per IP address

technical_info.auth_method: None for public data - OAuth for user-specific actions

endpoints.description: Searches species observations with location, date, quality, and taxonomic filtering options
endpoints.response_format: JSON with observation records and photos

endpoints.description: Searches taxonomic information including common names, photos, and conservation status
endpoints.response_format: JSON with taxonomic data and images

endpoints.description: Returns geographic places and administrative boundaries with observation statistics

content_summary.geographic_scope: Global coverage with strong representation in populated areas
content_summary.update_frequency: Real-time updates as community contributes observations

research_notes.data_quality: Community-verified with research grade designations for high-quality records
research_notes.researcher_notes: Large citizen science database with over 100 million observations. Quality filtering available through research grade designation. Rich photo and location data.
research_notes.api_summary: The iNaturalist API provides access to one of the world's largest citizen science biodiversity databases, enabling researchers to leverage millions of community-contributed species observations for ecological research, conservation planning, and biodiversity monitoring. The platform's unique combination of crowd-sourced observations, expert identifications, and rich multimedia content creates valuable datasets for understanding species distributions and ecosystem health.

name: eBird API
description: REST API providing access to the world's largest biodiversity citizen science database focused on bird observations. Includes real-time bird sightings, species distributions, abundance data, and migration patterns from millions of birdwatchers globally.

access_info.pricing_model: Free with API key registration
access_info.rate_limits: 100 requests per minute per API key

endpoints.description: Returns recent bird observations from specified geographic region with species and count data
Gets recent observations for specific bird species in geographic region
Retrieves recent bird observations within specified geographic coordinates and radius

content_summary.geographic_scope: Global coverage with detailed data for most countries
content_summary.update_frequency: Real-time updates as observers submit checklists

research_notes.data_quality: High quality citizen science data with review processes for rare species
research_notes.researcher_notes: World's largest bird database with over 1 billion observations. Strong data quality controls and expert review for unusual records. Excellent API documentation.
research_notes.api_summary: The eBird API provides researchers, conservationists, and bird enthusiasts with access to the world's largest and most comprehensive bird observation database, enabling studies of avian ecology, migration patterns, population trends, and conservation status assessment. Managed by the Cornell Lab of Ornithology, it represents a premier example of citizen science contributing to scientific research and conservation decision-making.

name: Ocean Biogeographic Information System API
description: REST API providing access to marine biodiversity data including species occurrences, taxonomic information, and environmental data from global ocean surveys and research programs. Serves as the primary repository for marine species distribution and abundance information.

access_info.pricing_model: Free access under OBIS data sharing principles
access_info.rate_limits: No explicit limits documented

endpoints.description: Searches marine species occurrence records with taxonomic, geographic, and temporal filters
Returns taxonomic information for marine species including classification hierarchy
Provides summary statistics on marine biodiversity data coverage and completeness

content_summary.geographic_scope: Global ocean coverage including all marine environments
content_summary.update_frequency: Regular updates from contributing research institutions

research_notes.data_quality: Research-grade marine biodiversity data from scientific institutions
research_notes.researcher_notes: Comprehensive global marine biodiversity database. Strong integration with taxonomic authorities. Geographic and depth filtering capabilities for marine environments.
research_notes.api_summary: The OBIS API provides marine researchers, conservationists, and ecosystem managers with authoritative access to the world's most comprehensive database of marine species distributions and biodiversity information. As the official data system for marine biodiversity under the International Oceanographic Commission, it enables evidence-based marine conservation, ecosystem assessment, and oceanographic research across all ocean basins.
